page.title: 04Old Buildings, New Uses
page.content: There are many firms in{Malmesbury which have moved into old industrial buildings. One such firm is{Print {Aids,}which buys and sells inks and chemicals to printers, and supplies films for photographs. The building used to be a vetinary office, and before that, a coal yard. Print Aids would prefer to move into a newer building, as there are too many rooms and they would prefer just one big one with all the machinery in that room. The{George Hotel}in the High Street has been a vetinary surgery since 1979. It used to be a coaching inn. They have found broken crockery and clay pipes in the grounds.{A ghost is meant to haunt the building, but the staff have not seen it (yet!).
